text:
I've spent a couple of days trying to get ibus unikey/bamboo working on Linux without success and am very happy to have found this. :)

BUT - at the moment it's working perfectly for me in gmail, but if I try to type in google docs it doesn't work properly.
Can anyone tell me what I'm doing wrong? Is there a quick fix?

Even if not, gmail is better than nothing.
please remove console log. thank you !!!

Work on kde/gnome/i3, but the last word before enter to send lose vietnamese lanaguage.
Pls improve freedom typing like 'zia2'
This extension is great, very helpful.
Used to use it. Now I re-install it because Unikey appears to not support Chrome 69 at the moment. But AVIM also does not support. Waiting for a fix : )
This is one of `can not survive without it` extension :) thanks for all your helpful work :clap:
Doesn't work on Google Docs on Version 64.0.3282.168 (Official Build) (64-bit) for Windows.

Thank you so much for this great extension. 
This help me a lot when a work on Linux latop.
it's good

I'm using IBUS to type Vietnamese in my Linux OS laptop. 
Sometimes conflict occurs switching Vietnamese and English keyboards. 
Your product saves my time and effort. Thank you very much. Keep on your great you.
Great.
its better if the 2 "]", "[" can be typed as "ow" and "uw"
Not running in CentOS
ok

Wow, this plugin is easy to use, works really fast and especially helps me type Vietnamese even when using Kaspersky Chrome Safe Browser in Safe Money feature. My Unikey is blocked when I'm switching to "Protected Browser" in Kaspersky. Thank you for your hard work creating this nice plugin kimkha. I really appreciate it.
Great :)
need to support all the google productivity apps :)
k go dc
thank you, this is what I need for Chrome on Ubuntu or Linux in general :)
simply and works very well
It works very well, Chromium (linux) does no need other input method editor programs
good
good
Good job!
good

Effective, just like Vietkey, I use it with Chromebook too. GSheet and Gsearch are perfectly fine. However, I could not use gDocs and  blog writing apps with this. I mean, c'mon, then what do you buy a Chromebook for if not basic writing function???? 
TO App Developer: Plz fix this soon. Thank you, have a nice day.
Works very well
Not working
You saved my life. Thanks a lot from a Chromebook user!

Thanks 
It's beneficial for me
it works well

love it,
Thanks you!!!!

Just installed. Does not work on Chromebook however. Any help?
dc
love it! Thank you very much ,Kha:)

It does not work with my Google Chrome on my openSUSE 12-3 LXDE.

Therefore, I am removing it.
good
Excellent, and thanks so much. Thanks to my roommate D. Bruce introduced to your website .
This is a excellent extension for chrome. Special for Ubuntu user like me ^^
Good but would like to request VIQR input method. Thank you!
well...i cant use it on anything... :(

This is a good extension on Chrome. It does a decent job turning Roman alphabet into Vietnamese alphabet. Yet, the Telex option does not support fast typing. For example, if you want to spell "được", you have to spell "dduwowcj", instead of "dduowcj". I know it's just a one character difference, but it does boost the typing speed and provide comfort for the users.

Thanks for making the software, and I hope there will be some improvement.
I like this. It works well, in almost case. Thanks author.
Thanks for your great idea but I can't type Vietnamese here or Google  docs.
a extentsion good!
good job, but it doesn't work with gmail
Awesome extension for Vietnamese
It's pretty good home brew app and works fine on couple Vietnamese forums, websites. But It doesn't work on Google Docs.
